original: Section 2.03   [Limited License] . Limited License. Throughout the Term of this Agreement, the parties hereby agree to grant to each other a limited license to use each other's proprietary marks solely in connection with the sale, distribution, marketing and promotion of each party's calling cards by the other party. Both parties hereto shall exercise such license in compliance with the quality and other standards established by the party owning such marks. Except as set forth herein, neither party shall use the other party's proprietary marks without the prior, express, written consent of the other party. All rights to either party's proprietary marks shall remain with the owner of the marks.
ollama_generated:
Section 2.03   [Expanded Permission]. Permissive Authorization. For the duration of this Agreement, the parties mutually consent to extend an expansive permission to utilize each other's proprietary trademarks, not only in relation to the sale, distribution, marketing, and promotion of each party's calling cards, but also in any additional collaborative ventures that may emerge during the term. Each party acknowledges and agrees to adhere to the quality standards and other regulations as set forth by the owning party for their respective trademarks. It is explicitly understood that without the prior, express, written approval of both parties, neither shall employ the other's proprietary marks in any context outside of this Agreement. The exclusive rights to each party's proprietary marks will continue to reside with the original owners.

In this revised clause, the permission granted for using the trademarks is expanded beyond just selling, distributing, marketing, and promoting calling cards, to include additional collaborative ventures that may emerge during the term of the Agreement. Additionally, the responsibility of adhering to quality standards and other regulations now falls on both parties equally, rather than solely on the party owning the trademarks.

original: ARTICLE VI   [Termination] Termination Section 6.01   [Termination for Cause] . Termination for Cause. In the event that either PrimeCall or DeltaThree materially breaches any of its duties or obligations hereunder, which breach shall not be cured within thirty (30) days after written notice is given to the breaching party specifying the breach, then either PrimeCall or DeltaThree, as the case may be, may, by giving written notice thereof to the other, terminate this Agreement as of a date specified in such notice of termination, which date shall be no earlier than ten (10) days after the date of such notice.
ollama_generated: ARTICLE VI   [Termination] Termination Section 6.02   [Termination without Cause] . Termination without Cause. Either PrimeCall or DeltaThree may terminate this Agreement at any time, with or without cause, by providing written notice to the other party. The effective date of termination shall be thirty (30) days after the date of such notice, unless earlier terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement or applicable law. However, if either PrimeCall or DeltaThree is currently in material breach of any duty or obligation hereunder and such breach remains uncured at the time of termination, the non-breaching party shall not be liable for any damages arising from such breach.

original: Section 9.08   [Severability] . Severability. If any provision of this Agreement or the application of any provision hereof to any person or circumstances is held invalid, the remainder of this Agreement and the application of such provision to other persons or circumstances shall not be affected unless the provision held invalid shall substantially impair the benefits of the remaining portions of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Section 9.08 [Severability]. In the event that any provision of this Agreement, or the application of such provision to a specific individual or situation, is deemed unenforceable, it shall be understood and agreed that the entirety of this Agreement may still stand, with the inapplicable or unenforceable portion being deemed null and void, provided that the deletion or adjustment does not significantly alter the overall balance or intended benefits of the remaining provisions of this Agreement.

This revised clause emphasizes that if any part of the agreement is invalidated, the rest of the agreement will remain intact unless the deleted or adjusted portion substantially alters the overall intent and benefits of the remaining parts.

original: Section 9.11   [Governing Law] . Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of New York , without giving effect to the conflict of laws principles thereof. For purposes of this Source: DELTATHREE INC, S-1/A, 11/2/1999 Agreement, each party hereby irrevocably submits to the nonexclusive jurisdiction of the courts of the State of New York, sitting in New York County, and the courts of the United States for the Southern District of New York. Each party irrevocably waives, to the fullest extent permitted by law, any objection which it may now or hereafter have to the laying of the venue of any such suit, action or proceeding brought in any such court, any claim that any such suit, action or proceeding brought in such a court has been brought in an inconvenient forum and the right to object, with respect to any such suit, action or proceeding brought in any such court, that such court does not have jurisdiction over such party. In any such suit, action or proceeding, each party waives, to the fullest extent it may effectively do so, personal service of any summons, complaint or other process and agrees that the service thereof may be made by certified or registered mail, addressed to such party at its address set forth in Section 9.03   [Notices] . Each party agrees that a final non-appealable judgment in any such suit, action or proceeding brought in such a court shall be conclusive and binding.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Section 9.11   [Governing Law and Jurisdiction] . Jurisdictional Clauses. This Agreement will be subject to the legal framework of New York State, acknowledging but disregarding its conflict of laws provisions. In reference to this DELTATHREE INC, S-1/A, 11/2/1999 Contract, both parties hereby consent to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts within New York County, New York, and the federal courts for the Southern District of New York. Each party relinquishes, to the maximum extent permissible by law, any initial objection regarding the selection of venue for any legal action, claim that such court selection is inconvenient, or assertion that the chosen court lacks jurisdiction over either party. In any potential litigation, each party agrees to accept service by certified or registered mail, delivered to their respective addresses provided in Section 9.03   [Notices] . Each party acknowledges and accepts that a binding verdict in any such legal action, free from the possibility of appeal, will be final and enforceable.

Changes made:
- Switched from "nonexclusive" jurisdiction to "exclusive" jurisdiction
- Modified the language to indicate that the parties consent to the jurisdiction, rather than irrevocably submitting to it (which implies no choice)
- Changed the phrase "Each party irrevocably waives" to "Each party relinquishes," implying a more active and conscious decision on the part of the parties
- Modified the clause so that each party now agrees to accept service by mail, rather than having service made by mail
- Reworded the final sentence to indicate that the binding verdict can be enforced, not just concluded and binding (in some contexts, a conclusion might imply an outcome that is not enforceable)

original: Section 9.12   [Captions] . Captions. The captions appearing in this Agreement are inserted only as a matter of convenience and for reference and in no way define, limit or describe the scope and intent of this Agreement or any of the provisions hereof.
ollama_generated: Section 9.12 [Headings]. Headings. The headings included within this Agreement are merely intended as aids for navigation and reading ease, and do not in any way serve to limit, extend, or otherwise alter the scope, interpretation, or intent of any clause or provision contained herein. In the event of any inconsistency between a heading and the corresponding text, the language of the body shall control.
